txt.en:
'The centerpiece for every good Mathom Society dinner is a honey-roasted chicken. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!

'Our Master Chef has been tasked with cataloguing all mathoms smaller than a pie tin...a pie tin! I have no idea if he will be able to finish cooking the chicken for our next dinner in time.

'Without a honey roasted-chicken, we simply cannot hold our meeting. Please, [placeholder], help us find a honey-roasted chicken in time for our meeting.'
'Is that...? It is! A honey-roasted chicken! You have saved the Mathom Society dinner, [placeholder]. You have my most sincere thanks.'
'Oh dear, what will we do without a honey-roasted chicken? I will be shamed out of my office of chairman of the dinner committee if I can not find one before the next meeting.'
Baldwin Foxtail told you that a honey-roasted chicken is always the centerpiece of the Mathom Society dinner, but the Master Chef has been too busy to prepare one.
Bring the honey-roasted chicken to Baldwin Foxtail
Baldwin Foxtail is at the Mathom House in Michel Delving in the Shire.\n\nBaldwin Foxtail has asked you to bring him a honey-roasted chicken for the cooks of the Mathom Society.
